Title: CERN (the European Organization for Nuclear Research) is famous for its work in particle physics and operates the world's largest particle accelerator
Description: the Large Hadron Collider (LHC). In the study of subatomic particles
column3: CERN utilizes specialized containment and detection chambers to observe
column4: manipulate
column5: and study subatomic particles such as protons
column6: neutrons
column8: and even more exotic particles like quarks and neutrinos.

Title: ### Types of Containment Chambers and Detectors at CERN
* **Bubble Chambers**: These were once used to detect charged particles. A superheated liquid (like liquid hydrogen) is contained in the chamber
Description: and when charged particles pass through
column3: they ionize the liquid along their path
column4: creating bubbles that can be photographed.

Title: * **Cloud Chambers**: A gas-filled chamber with supersaturated vapor. As charged particles pass through
Description: they leave trails of ionized gas
column3: which form condensation tracks that can be seen.

Title: * TPCs are advanced detectors used for tracking the movement of charged particles in three dimensions. They contain gas that becomes ionized when particles pass through
Description: and an electric field guides the resulting ions to a detection plane. The signals are then used to reconstruct the particles' paths.

Title: * **Electromagnetic Calorimeters**: These detectors measure the energy of particles like electrons and photons by stopping them in a dense material and measuring the resulting electromagnetic shower of particles.
* **Hadronic Calorimeters**: Used to detect hadrons (particles like protons
column3: and pions). They measure the energy of these particles as they interact with the dense material
column4: creating hadronic showers.

Title: * Silicon-based detectors are widely used for tracking particles due to their high resolution. These detectors utilize layers of silicon sensors to measure the position and trajectory of passing particles with great precision.

* These specialized detectors are located outside the main layers of other detectors because muons (heavier cousins of electrons) can pass through most materials. The muon chambers identify and measure these particles after other types of particles have been absorbed by the inner detectors.
* These are used to confine charged particles
column3: using magnetic and electric fields. They allow for precise measurements of properties such as mass and charge.

Title: * CERN also uses cryogenic detectors that operate at extremely low temperatures. These detectors are designed to reduce thermal noise and allow the study of rare processes like neutrino interactions or dark matter detection.
While studying subatomic particles
Description: it is crucial to safely contain the high-energy collisions and secondary particles that are produced. The LHC's containment chambers use advanced shielding materials (like lead and concrete) to prevent radiation from escaping. Additionally
column3: detectors are housed in underground facilities to further limit exposure to radiation.

Title: These specialized containment chambers and detectors are essential for exploring the fundamental components of matter
column3: and making groundbreaking discoveries
column4: such as the Higgs boson in 2012.

The AGC chip model refers to the Apollo Guidance Computer (AGC)
Description: the onboard computer used in NASA's Apollo missions
column3: including the historic Apollo 11 moon landing. The AGC was a pioneering piece of technology
column4: featuring integrated circuits
column5: which were cutting-edge at the time. Here's an overview:

Title: Model: The AGC used custom-made integrated circuits (ICs) manufactured by Fairchild Semiconductor.
Type: The ICs were RTL (Resistor-Transistor Logic) chips
Description: each containing a single 3-input NOR gate.

Title: Quantity: Around 2
Description: 800 such ICs were used in each AGC.

Title: Processor: 16-bit word length (15 bits for data
2 kWords of erasable magnetic core memory (RAM).
36 kWords of read-only core rope memory (ROM).
Input/Output: Used the "DSKY" (Display and Keyboard) interface.
The AGC was revolutionary
Description: representing one of the first uses of ICs in any large-scale project. It played a critical role in navigation and control during Apollo missions
column3: managing real-time calculations and ensuring safe execution of mission-critical tasks.
